item.title: Waiheke Community Housing Trust Visitor Accommodation Hui : Kylee Matthews
item.description: Waiheke local board member Kylee Matthews speaks at a Waiheke Community Housing Trust hui focused on gaining support for a change to allow visitor accommodation units to be able to be let for long term rentals.

item.description: Jaimie Wilikie speaks about the island's housing shortage at a Waiheke Community Housing Trust hui focused on gaining support for a change to allow visitor accommodation units to be able to be let for long term rentals.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Archeological Research on Ōtata
item.description: Ōtata is the largest of The Noises islands. On the main beach of Ōtata Island is a large, historic midden, made up of layers of shells, animal bones and other archaeological evidence. Auckland Museum Archaeologists Dr Louise Furey and Emma Ash worked in collaboration with mana whenua, Ngāi Tai ki Tāmaki, and the Neureuter family, to undertake excavations of the Ōtata midden, with digs taking place during the March 2020 and again in February 2021. What that research showed was The Noises were vi...

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Wētāpunga on Ōtata
item.description: Sue Neureuter talks about the thriving population of New Zealand's largest insect, wētāpunga, on Ōtata. The wētāpunga is the largest insect in New Zealand. It's a nocturnal, tree-dwelling creature of the forest. The average body length of adult females is around 65 mm (2.6 in) from head to the tip of the abdomen. The species was extinct on mainland NZ by the 1870s. The Hauraki Gulf islands provided the last strongholds for wētāpunga. Formerly, the species was known from Aotea (Great Barrier Isl...

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Nikita Daniel: The Noises Coastal Marine Researcher
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Nikita Daniel about her research in the coastal areas of The Noises.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Sue Neureuter on the marine environment of The Noises
item.description: Noises custodian Sue Neureuter talks about efforts to protect and rejuvenate the marine environment around The Noises.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Bianca Ranson: Hauraki Gulf Protection
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Bianca Ranson, Waiheke Local Board representative on the Hauraki Gulf Forum and Forest and Bird National Conservation Advocate, about the Hauraki Gulf Marine Protection Bill and the delays in implementing it.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Sue Neureuter on Ōtata, The Noises
item.description: Sue Neureuter is custodian of The Noises, a group of small islands 7km Northeast of Waiheke. In this recording Sue talks about the early days of her family owning the islands and the conservation journey they have championed. Recorded on the largest of the islands, Ōtata in May 2025. The Noises lie around 7kn northeast of Waiheke Island. The island group has owned by the Wainright and Neureuter family since 1933, although in recent years it has been placed in a trust administered by the family....

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Jamie Stone Live at Waiheke Library May 2025
item.description: Jamie Stone performs live at Waiheke Library for NZ Music Month, May 2025.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Charmed Live at Waiheke Library May 2025
item.description:
Charmed recorded live at Waiheke Library during NZ Music Month, May 2025.
Charmed are a local Waiheke indie band born from Waiheke High School who have been practicing and gigging at school gigs for the last year. Initially known as 'Unfinished April' they were been inspired by Lo-Fi instrumental artists such as Khruangbin and Arc de Soleil.
The original line-up consisted of Issy Ciano on lead guitar, Nate Mansfield on Bass, Billie Treadwell on drums and Safi Sherwood on rhythm guitar. The b...

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Waiheke Open Orchestra Live at Waiheke Library
item.description: The Waiheke Open Orchestra performed at Waiheke Library for NZ Music Month, May 2025.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: InFocus Exhibition on the work of Waiheke Health Trust
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Waiheke Health Trust CEO Jen Glover about photographic exhibition InFocus - The Unseen Journey of Compassion, Commitment and Care which showcases the work of the trust.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Instrument Maker Peter Forster
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Waiheke musician and instrument maker Peter Forster.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Waiheke Author Belinda Robinson: Unforgetting
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Waiheke author Belinda Robinson about her memoir Unforgetting.From her childhood with parents Bruce and Diane Mason to hippy days on Waiheke and beyond. Photo credit: The Post

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Roger Jeffery, Janneke Visser and Gillian Baynes Live at Waiheke Library
item.description: Roger Jeffery, Janneke Visser and Gillian Baynes play live music at Waiheke Library as part of the library's NZ Music Month programme, 2025.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Peter Forster Live at Waiheke Library
item.description: Peter Forster played original songs live at Waiheke Library as part of their 2025 NZ Music Month series. Peter played guitars, flutes and a cello that he had made himself.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Catherine Mitchell Arts Centre: Past, Present, Future
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Helen Charters and Hilary Kerrod from the Catherine Mitchell Arts Centre. They talk about the origins and history of the centre which has been an important part of the local arts scene for more than 50 years.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: New Waiheke Music: Night Creams
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Jamie Stone and Rachel Woods from new local musical act Night Creams about the impending release of their album Auditions for a Melt Movie

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Ostend Market 50th Anniversary
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Penny Holmes of Waiheke Community Childcare Centre about the history of the Waiheke Ostend Market. The market, a centrepiece of the island community, has it's 50th anniversary Easter 2025. The interview ends abruptly due to a power cut.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Market Talks: Mattias Kroeger
item.description: Penny Holmes talks to Mattias Kroeger as part of her documentation of the history of the Waiheke Ostend Market to mark it's 50th anniversay at Easter 2025.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Market Talks: Kathryn Ngapo
item.description: Penny Holmes talks to Kathryn Ngapo as part of her documentation of the history of the Waiheke Ostend Market to mark it's 50th anniversay at Easter 2025.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Market Talks: Audrey Betterton
item.description: Penny Holmes talks to Audrey Betterton as part of her documentation of the history of the Waiheke Ostend Market to mark it's 50th anniversay at Easter 2025.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Cath Handley: Local Board Plan Consultation
item.description: Chris Walker to Local Board chair Cath Handley about consultation on the local board annual plan.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Waiheke Chamber Music Festival
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Amalia Hall about the upcoming Waiheke Chamber Music festival, 23-24 March.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Central Landscape Supplies Celebrate 20 Years
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Dean Risetto, owner of Central Landscape Supplies Waiheke. They are marking 20 years in the Waiheke community with a family fun day on Sat 15 March 10am-12pm, 88 Onetangi Rd.

item.itunes:author: Waiheke Radio
item.title: Can You Dig It?! s02e06: Chardy Parkes
item.description: Chris Walker talks to Waiheke Resources Trust gardener Chardy Parkes about how she came to wander down the garden path and her approach to gardening on Waiheke.
